Session.Abandon\ RedirectWithFlash "customers.asp", "You have been logged out."\ %>\ } ### FILE: includes/orders.asp {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf2867 \cocoatextscaling0\cocoaplatform0{\fonttbl\f0\fswiss\fcharset0 Helvetica;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} {\*\expandedcolortbl;;} \margl1440\margr1440\vieww11520\viewh8400\viewkind0 \pard\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7920\tx8640\pardirnatural\partightenfactor0 \f0\fs24 \cf0 <%@ Language="VBScript" %>\ \ \ <%\ Option Explicit\ \ Call EnsureInMemoryData()\ Call RequireLogin()\ \ Dim action\ action = LCase(Trim(Request("action")))\ \ Select Case action\ Case "create"\ Call HandleCreate()\ Case "update"\ Call HandleUpdate()\ End Select\ \ Sub HandleCreate()\ Dim custId, status, total\ custId = CLng(0)\ status = Trim(Request.Form("status"))\ total = CDbl(0)\ \ On Error Resume Next\ custId = CLng(Request.Form("customerId"))\ total = CDbl(Request.Form("total"))\ On Error GoTo 0\ \ If custId <= 0 Or status = "" Or total <= 0 Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "All fields are required, total must be > 0."\ End If\ \ Dim orders, nextId\ Set orders = Application("Orders")\ \ Application.Lock\ nextId = CLng(Application("NextOrderId"))\ orders.Add nextId, Array(custId, status, total, Now())\ Application("NextOrderId") = nextId + 1\ Application.UnLock\ \ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order " & nextId & " created."\ End Sub\ \ Sub HandleUpdate()\ Dim orderId, newStatus\ orderId = CLng(0)\ On Error Resume Next\ orderId = CLng(Request.Form("orderId"))\ On Error GoTo 0\ \ newStatus = Trim(Request.Form("newStatus"))\ If orderId <= 0 Or newStatus = "" Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order ID and new status are required."\ End If\ \ Dim orders\ Set orders = Application("Orders")\ \ If Not orders.Exists(orderId) Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order not found."\ End If\ \ Dim data\ data = orders(orderId)\ \ Dim custId, total, createdAt\ custId = data(0)\ total = data(2)\ createdAt = data(3)\ \ Application.Lock\ orders(orderId) = Array(custId, newStatus, total, createdAt)\ Application.UnLock\ \ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order " & orderId & " updated."\ End Sub\ \ Call RenderHeader("Orders")\ %>\ \

IDCustomerStatusTotalCreatedUpdate status
<%=oid%><%=HtmlEncode(custName)%><%=HtmlEncode(status)%><%=FormatCurrency(total, 2)%><%=createdAt%>\

system_context_model.summary: Legacy ASP application for customer and order management, targeted for modernization to Node.js.

convention_profile.summary: Analysis of coding conventions and practices in the legacy ASP codebase.

rules.rule: Ensure session management for user authentication.

lint_recommendations: Adopt consistent naming conventions across the codebase.
Implement more robust error handling mechanisms.
scaffold_templates: Node.js Express application structure with session management.

health_assessment.summary: Health assessment of the legacy ASP codebase, highlighting maintainability, security, and reliability concerns.

risks.title: Session Fixation
risks.description: The current session management approach may allow session fixation attacks.

remediation_backlog.title: Modernize Session Management
remediation_backlog.problem_statement: The legacy session management approach is vulnerable to session fixation attacks.
remediation_backlog.risk_if_unaddressed: Potential unauthorized access due to session fixation.
remediation_backlog.suggested_approach: Implement session regeneration on login in the Node.js application.
success_criteria: Session is regenerated on each login.
No session fixation vulnerabilities detected in security tests.

agent_results.summary: Extracted 8 functional requirements, 5 non-functional requirements, 5 risks, 3 clarifications, 0 failed quality gates [software-general-v1]

analysis_walkthrough.business_objective_summary: Modernize a legacy ASP codebase to Node.js, ensuring functional parity and backward compatibility, while implementing new architecture and testing for deployment in Docker.
requirements_understanding: The legacy system uses ASP with VBScript for session management, user authentication, and order processing.
The modernization effort involves translating this functionality to Node.js with equivalent behavior.
Backward compatibility is critical, meaning the new system must behave identically from a user's perspective.
The system must be deployable in a Docker environment, indicating containerization is a requirement.
conversion_to_technical_requirements: Translate ASP session and application state management to Node.js using Express.js and middleware.
Implement user authentication and session management using Node.js sessions or JWT.
Migrate data handling from in-memory dictionaries to a database like MongoDB or PostgreSQL.
Ensure the Node.js application is containerized using Docker with appropriate Dockerfiles and configurations.
clarifications_requested: Is there a preference for a specific database technology?
Are there any additional security requirements beyond standard practices?
Should the modernization include any new features or strictly maintain existing functionality?

output.executive_summary: This project involves modernizing a legacy ASP codebase into Node.js, ensuring functional parity and backward compatibility, with deployment readiness for Docker environments.

functional_requirements.title: Application State Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement application state management in Node.js to track total sessions and application name.
acceptance_criteria: Application name is set to 'Legacy Customer Orders' on start.
Total sessions are incremented on session start and decremented on session end.
State changes are reflected in real-time across all sessions.

functional_requirements.title: User Authentication
functional_requirements.description: Implement user authentication in Node.js to manage user sessions and flash messages.
acceptance_criteria: Users can log in with a username, setting session variables for authentication.
Flash messages are displayed upon login and logout actions.
Unauthenticated users are redirected to the login page with an appropriate message.

functional_requirements.title: Customer Data Handling
functional_requirements.description: Migrate customer data handling from in-memory to a database, ensuring data integrity and accessibility.
acceptance_criteria: Customer data is stored and retrieved from a database.
Customer list is displayed correctly on the customers page.
Data operations are performed with error handling and logging.

functional_requirements.title: Order Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement order creation and update functionalities in Node.js, maintaining existing business logic.
acceptance_criteria: Orders can be created with customer ID, status, and total amount.
Orders can be updated with a new status.
Order operations reflect changes immediately and are logged.

functional_requirements.title: HTML Rendering
functional_requirements.description: Implement HTML rendering for headers and footers in Node.js, maintaining the current layout and styles.
acceptance_criteria: Headers and footers are rendered with the correct HTML structure.
Styles are applied consistently across all pages.
Dynamic data such as session counts and user names are displayed correctly.

functional_requirements.title: Session Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement session management in Node.js to handle user sessions and application state.
acceptance_criteria: Sessions are created and destroyed correctly on user login and logout.
Session data is accessible across different requests.
Session expiration is handled appropriately.

functional_requirements.title: Flash Messaging
functional_requirements.description: Implement flash messaging in Node.js to provide user feedback on actions.
acceptance_criteria: Flash messages are set and displayed on user actions.
Messages are cleared after being displayed once.
Flash messages are styled consistently with the application theme.

functional_requirements.title: Docker Deployment
functional_requirements.description: Prepare the Node.js application for deployment in a Docker environment.
acceptance_criteria: A Dockerfile is provided for building the application container.
The application runs correctly within a Docker container.
Environment variables are used for configuration within Docker.

non_functional_requirements.title: Performance
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the Node.js application performs efficiently under expected load.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Response time under 200ms for 95% of requests.
acceptance_criteria: Load testing shows response times under 200ms for 95% of requests.
The application can handle concurrent sessions without degradation.
Performance metrics are logged and monitored.

non_functional_requirements.title: Security
non_functional_requirements.description: Implement security measures to protect user data and application integrity.
non_functional_requirements.metric: No critical vulnerabilities in security scans.
acceptance_criteria: Security scans show no critical vulnerabilities.
User data is encrypted in transit and at rest.
Authentication mechanisms are resistant to common attacks.

non_functional_requirements.title: Scalability
non_functional_requirements.description: Design the application to scale horizontally to accommodate increased load.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Application can scale to handle 1000 concurrent users.
acceptance_criteria: Application architecture supports horizontal scaling.
Load tests confirm scalability to 1000 concurrent users.
Database and session management support distributed environments.

non_functional_requirements.title: Reliability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is reliable and available with minimal downtime.
acceptance_criteria: Monitoring shows 99.9% uptime over a month.
Automated recovery procedures are in place for failures.
Error handling and logging are implemented for all critical operations.

non_functional_requirements.title: Usability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is user-friendly and accessible.
non_functional_requirements.metric: User satisfaction score of 4.5/5 in usability tests.
acceptance_criteria: Usability tests show a satisfaction score of 4.5/5.
The application meets accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1).
User feedback mechanisms are in place and monitored.

assumptions: The modernization will not introduce new features beyond the existing functionality.
The application will be containerized using Docker for deployment.
Node.js will be used with Express.js for server-side logic.

risks.description: Potential data loss during migration from in-memory to database.
risks.mitigation: Implement thorough data migration testing and validation.

risks.description: Security vulnerabilities in the new Node.js application.
risks.mitigation: Conduct regular security audits and use secure coding practices.

risks.description: Performance degradation due to architectural changes.
risks.mitigation: Perform load testing and optimize code for performance.

risks.description: Compatibility issues with existing client-side code.
risks.mitigation: Ensure backward compatibility and test with existing clients.

risks.description: Docker deployment issues due to misconfiguration.
risks.mitigation: Use best practices for Docker configuration and testing.

out_of_scope: Development of new features not present in the legacy system.
Integration with third-party services not currently used.

The application will be containerized using Docker for deployment.
Node.js will be used with Express.js for server-side logic.

quality_gates.message: At least one functional requirement exists.

vector_context_used.title: Idempotent financial writes
vector_context_used.snippet: Financial write endpoints should require an idempotency key, persist request hash, and return the original response for retried keys with the same payload.

vector_context_used.title: PII-safe logging
vector_context_used.snippet: Logs must avoid raw personal identifiers. Use central redaction, field allowlists, and explicit data retention windows per tenant policy.

vector_context_used.title: Audit evidence chain
vector_context_used.snippet: Every regulated requirement should map to tests and release evidence. Audit events should include actor, action, timestamp, correlation_id, and outcome.

team.name: Synthetix Modernization Team
team.description: Legacy modernization team focused on functional parity and migration safety.

1.persona: Prioritize legacy parity, interface contracts, backward compatibility, and modernization risk documentation.

2.persona: Map legacy flows to modern services while minimizing migration risk and preserving business behavior.

3.persona: Rewrite legacy logic with functional parity first, then improve modularity without changing behavior.

4.persona: Design low-risk schema/data migration scripts with rollback plans and validation checkpoints.

5.persona: Produce threat models, prioritized security controls, and release-gating recommendations.

6.persona: Run actionable checks, separate environment issues from code defects, and produce clear remediation guidance.

7.persona: Validate requirement coverage clearly for business stakeholders with traceable evidence.

8.persona: Prefer local Docker deployability, deterministic health checks, and clear run instructions.

rules.title: Ensure session management for user authentication.
rules.statement: Ensure session management for user authentication.

templates.name: Node.js Express application structure with session management.

key_themes: Health assessment of the legacy ASP codebase, highlighting maintainability, security, and reliability concerns.
summary.recommendation: Prioritize P0/P1 remediation items and enforce convention gates in CI
summary.notes: Generated from SIL health assessment and remediation backlog

findings.title: Session Fixation
findings.description: The current session management approach may allow session fixation attacks.

backlog.title: Modernize Session Management
backlog.business_value: Potential unauthorized access due to session fixation.
plan: Implement session regeneration on login in the Node
acceptance_criteria: Session is regenerated on each login.
No session fixation vulnerabilities detected in security tests.

analysis_walkthrough.business_objective_summary: Modernize a legacy ASP codebase to Node.js, ensuring functional parity and backward compatibility, while implementing new architecture and testing for deployment in Docker.
requirements_understanding: The legacy system uses ASP with VBScript for session management, user authentication, and order processing.
The modernization effort involves translating this functionality to Node.js with equivalent behavior.
Backward compatibility is critical, meaning the new system must behave identically from a user's perspective.
The system must be deployable in a Docker environment, indicating containerization is a requirement.
conversion_to_technical_requirements: Translate ASP session and application state management to Node.js using Express.js and middleware.
Implement user authentication and session management using Node.js sessions or JWT.
Migrate data handling from in-memory dictionaries to a database like MongoDB or PostgreSQL.
Ensure the Node.js application is containerized using Docker with appropriate Dockerfiles and configurations.
clarifications_requested: Is there a preference for a specific database technology?
Are there any additional security requirements beyond standard practices?
Should the modernization include any new features or strictly maintain existing functionality?

analyst_output.executive_summary: This project involves modernizing a legacy ASP codebase into Node.js, ensuring functional parity and backward compatibility, with deployment readiness for Docker environments.

functional_requirements.title: Application State Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement application state management in Node.js to track total sessions and application name.
acceptance_criteria: Application name is set to 'Legacy Customer Orders' on start.
Total sessions are incremented on session start and decremented on session end.
State changes are reflected in real-time across all sessions.

functional_requirements.title: User Authentication
functional_requirements.description: Implement user authentication in Node.js to manage user sessions and flash messages.
acceptance_criteria: Users can log in with a username, setting session variables for authentication.
Flash messages are displayed upon login and logout actions.
Unauthenticated users are redirected to the login page with an appropriate message.

functional_requirements.title: Customer Data Handling
functional_requirements.description: Migrate customer data handling from in-memory to a database, ensuring data integrity and accessibility.
acceptance_criteria: Customer data is stored and retrieved from a database.
Customer list is displayed correctly on the customers page.
Data operations are performed with error handling and logging.

functional_requirements.title: Order Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement order creation and update functionalities in Node.js, maintaining existing business logic.
acceptance_criteria: Orders can be created with customer ID, status, and total amount.
Orders can be updated with a new status.
Order operations reflect changes immediately and are logged.

functional_requirements.title: HTML Rendering
functional_requirements.description: Implement HTML rendering for headers and footers in Node.js, maintaining the current layout and styles.
acceptance_criteria: Headers and footers are rendered with the correct HTML structure.
Styles are applied consistently across all pages.
Dynamic data such as session counts and user names are displayed correctly.

functional_requirements.title: Session Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement session management in Node.js to handle user sessions and application state.
acceptance_criteria: Sessions are created and destroyed correctly on user login and logout.
Session data is accessible across different requests.
Session expiration is handled appropriately.

functional_requirements.title: Flash Messaging
functional_requirements.description: Implement flash messaging in Node.js to provide user feedback on actions.
acceptance_criteria: Flash messages are set and displayed on user actions.
Messages are cleared after being displayed once.
Flash messages are styled consistently with the application theme.

functional_requirements.title: Docker Deployment
functional_requirements.description: Prepare the Node.js application for deployment in a Docker environment.
acceptance_criteria: A Dockerfile is provided for building the application container.
The application runs correctly within a Docker container.
Environment variables are used for configuration within Docker.

non_functional_requirements.title: Performance
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the Node.js application performs efficiently under expected load.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Response time under 200ms for 95% of requests.
acceptance_criteria: Load testing shows response times under 200ms for 95% of requests.
The application can handle concurrent sessions without degradation.
Performance metrics are logged and monitored.

non_functional_requirements.title: Security
non_functional_requirements.description: Implement security measures to protect user data and application integrity.
non_functional_requirements.metric: No critical vulnerabilities in security scans.
acceptance_criteria: Security scans show no critical vulnerabilities.
User data is encrypted in transit and at rest.
Authentication mechanisms are resistant to common attacks.

non_functional_requirements.title: Scalability
non_functional_requirements.description: Design the application to scale horizontally to accommodate increased load.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Application can scale to handle 1000 concurrent users.
acceptance_criteria: Application architecture supports horizontal scaling.
Load tests confirm scalability to 1000 concurrent users.
Database and session management support distributed environments.

non_functional_requirements.title: Reliability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is reliable and available with minimal downtime.
acceptance_criteria: Monitoring shows 99.9% uptime over a month.
Automated recovery procedures are in place for failures.
Error handling and logging are implemented for all critical operations.

non_functional_requirements.title: Usability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is user-friendly and accessible.
non_functional_requirements.metric: User satisfaction score of 4.5/5 in usability tests.
acceptance_criteria: Usability tests show a satisfaction score of 4.5/5.
The application meets accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1).
User feedback mechanisms are in place and monitored.

assumptions: The modernization will not introduce new features beyond the existing functionality.
The application will be containerized using Docker for deployment.
Node.js will be used with Express.js for server-side logic.

risks.description: Potential data loss during migration from in-memory to database.
risks.mitigation: Implement thorough data migration testing and validation.

risks.description: Security vulnerabilities in the new Node.js application.
risks.mitigation: Conduct regular security audits and use secure coding practices.

risks.description: Performance degradation due to architectural changes.
risks.mitigation: Perform load testing and optimize code for performance.

risks.description: Compatibility issues with existing client-side code.
risks.mitigation: Ensure backward compatibility and test with existing clients.

risks.description: Docker deployment issues due to misconfiguration.
risks.mitigation: Use best practices for Docker configuration and testing.

out_of_scope: Development of new features not present in the legacy system.
Integration with third-party services not currently used.

intake.business_request_raw: Modernize the provided legacy codebase into Node.js. Document current functionality and acceptance criteria, design architecture, implement rewritten services, run QA/security checks, validate requirements, and deploy for local Docker testing.
assumptions: The modernization will not introduce new features beyond the existing functionality.
The application will be containerized using Docker for deployment.
Node.js will be used with Express.js for server-side logic.

Map acceptance criteria to executable test types.

scenarios.name: Successful login
gherkin: Given a user is on the login page
When they enter a valid username
And submit the form
Then they should be logged in
And see a welcome message

scenarios.name: Create a new order
gherkin: Given a user is logged in
When they fill in the order form with valid data
And submit the form
Then a new order should be created
And a confirmation message should be displayed

scenarios.name: Session starts and ends
gherkin: Given a user logs in
When a session is created
Then the session count should increase
And when the session ends
The session count should decrease

scenarios.name: Application runs in Docker
gherkin: Given the application is containerized
When it is deployed in Docker
Then it should run without errors
And be accessible via the configured port
